data.title: Who We Are — Hoboken Public Education Foundation
data.text:
Allison has lived in Hoboken since 2006 and has two children currently attending Hoboken Public Schools. She joined the Hoboken Public Education Foundation in 2024 as its inaugural Executive Director, bringing over 12 years of nonprofit and public sector leadership experience, to oversee the organization's operations, fundraising efforts, community impact and engagement, and strategic planning.

Previously Allison managed the development and early implementation of a pioneering $100 million grant program aimed at building broadband infrastructure in affordable housing properties across New York for the State’s broadband office. She also served as Chief of Staff and Director of Resident Empowerment and Community Engagement at the Jersey City Housing Authority (JCHA), where she coordinated strategic interdepartmental collaboration and operations, and developed and oversaw partnerships with dozens of local, state, and national organizations to offer a range of services and resources to JCHA’s nearly 15,000 residents. Her passion for educational equity and community development drives her commitment to furthering the mission of the Hoboken Public Education Foundation.

Jackie and her husband moved from Manhattan to Hoboken in 2006 as expectant parents looking for more space in which to raise their son. They found a welcoming, tight-knit community and soon thereafter decided to make Hoboken their long-term home. As Jackie started attending school board meetings and learning more about statewide funding cuts, she wanted to proactively help support the district schools; she became one of the co-founders of Hoboken PEF, and now manages its operations and business sponsorships. Jackie and her husband have one boy who attends Hoboken High School. Jackie is a SVP at Alliant, a national employee benefits brokerage firm.

Hannah Gordon has called Hoboken home since 2004, and has two boys in Hoboken Public Schools. Hannah joined the Hoboken PEF team to contribute to the ongoing improvement of the Hoboken public school system. She particularly enjoys helping manage the foundation's events and fundraising. Hannah earned her doctorate in organizational psychology from Rutgers, and has nearly 10 years of experience in the area of talent management, a specialty human resources function.

Susan and her family moved back to Hoboken after living overseas on an international assignment for three years. Prior to that, she and her husband met in Hoboken in 2005 after both having already lived in Hoboken for a few years. They are the proud parents of one son who is a student in Hoboken Public Schools. Susan has over 20 years of marketing and sales experience and a Master’s Degree in Administrative Science. While living overseas, Susan served as a charity committee member working closely with a school for the hearing impaired, as well as a home for young adults with disabilities. Susan’s love for Hoboken and its Hoboken Public Schools drives her to dedicate her time to the foundation. She also serves as a chair member of the Wallace PTO, and is a class parent. Susan joins the Hoboken Public Education Foundation with a true desire to help continue the strong sense of community and growth of families who are committed to raising their children in Hoboken and its Public Schools.

Amy Warshawsky moved to Hoboken in 2013 after living four years overseas. She has three children, one who graduated from Hoboken High School and one who is currently attending Hoboken High School after spending years at Wallace and HMS. Amy has nearly 20 years in event planning and close to 10 years as a professional business, health, wellness and life coach. Amy is dedicated to all Hoboken families realizing the excellent opportunities and education our children receive at Hoboken High School and all schools throughout the District.

Melinda Fried moved to Hoboken in 2011, one month before her daughter was born, where she and her husband started their family. Today her two children attend Hoboken Public Schools. Melinda has nearly 20 years of experience in Corporate Communications and Public Relations. She is currently the head of Corporate Communications for e.l.f. Beauty. She is so proud to call Hoboken her home and truly believes that the power of the #HobokenStrong community is unmatched.

Nicole has lived in Hoboken since 2007, and enjoys spending time in our mile square city with her husband and 2 children. Nicole's children attend T.G. Connors Elementary School, where Nicole serves as a member of the PTO. Nicole is a passionate supporter of the Hoboken Public School District and initially became involved with HPEF as a member of the fundraising team. Nicole is a Senior Contracts Manager at Google LLC.

Stan Zlotsky has been living in Hoboken since 2012 with his wife, Tatyana, and their two sons. Stan attended public school after immigrating to the US from Ukraine. Now with both kids in Hoboken’s Public Schools, he is passionate about the HPEF mission of helping to elevate the district’s schools and the overall education system. Stan is a Chartered Financial Analyst, with over 20 years of financial experience across Wall Street equity research and the software industry.

Cindy Smith moved to Hoboken in 2006 to begin her career in NYC. In the years since, she has worked in apparel design and is currently Design Director of DKNY Underwear. She and her husband, Tim, have two students thriving in the Hoboken Public School District. Cindy became involved with HPEF because she is passionate about supporting public schools and believes community involvement is essential to student success. She is devoted to creating opportunities for HPS students to apply and practice their knowledge using hands-on experiences.

Alongside her husband and daughter, Nicole relocated to Hoboken in February 2020, just before the onset of the pandemic, with the goal of enrolling her daughter in the Hoboken Public Schools for kindergarten. Having previously worked in the nonprofit and healthcare sectors, Nicole brings a wealth of professional experience to her role. With a strong belief in the power of public education, fueled by her own positive experiences in public schools, Nicole is passionate about enhancing the educational journey for students with diverse learning needs. Nicole's expertise in information and computer technologies in the nonprofit sector will be instrumental in enhancing the management, implementation, and usability of key systems to further advance the foundation's mission.

Erica Gavin has lived in Hoboken since 2005, and has two sons who attend Hoboken Public Schools. She has nearly 20 years of experience in communications and event planning, which serves her well in her event-planning activities for HPEF. In 2004, Erica established Erica Berg & Associates LLC, consulting for agencies, corporations, and not-for-profits focused on arts and education. Erica currently serves as Regional Director for DukeNY, working for the Duke Alumni Association.
